etymology.description: semantic: 癶 (“left and right feet”) + 豆 (“pictogrammic of raised object; stepping stone”); hands at the bottom disappeared, retained in conservative variant 𤼷.
etymology.interpretation: Feet placed on a raised object suggest climbing or mounting. Earlier forms even showed hands assisting the action, preserved in 𤼷, reinforcing the idea of ascent.

examples.chinese: 我们清晨登上山顶(我們清晨登上山頂)。
examples.english: We climbed to the mountaintop at dawn.

examples.chinese: 请提前一小时到机场办理登机(請提前一小時到機場辦理登機)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng tíqián yì xiǎoshí dào jīchǎng bànlǐ dēngjī.
examples.english: Please arrive at the airport an hour early to handle boarding.

examples.chinese: 重阳节人们登高望远(重陽節人們登高望遠)。
examples.english: On the Double Ninth Festival, people climb high to gaze into the distance.
